result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald F Perrault was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Credit of 170 days granted.
Consecutive to: Count 3

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
DNA surcharge WAIVED.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.
Mental Health/psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with victims or residences or Robert K., do not enter into anyone's residences without the Agent's approval.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

Restitution hearing set for 6/04/2015 @ 2:30PM.

AS OF 6/04/2015: Resitution was ordered of $1,172.57 ($541.57 to David D. and $631.00 to Greater Milwaukee Coin) To be paid from 25% of prison wages and then as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

records.addlTxt: Restitution hearing on June 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald F Perrault in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1 and Ct. 3. 
 
Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 8 years (Initial Confinement: 4 years - 170 days credit, Extended Supervision: 4 years) - consecutive to Ct. 3
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision 
- Restitution - hearing to be set
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with victims or residences or Robert K..  Do not enter into anyone's residence's without the Agents approval.  Mental Health/psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.   

Ct. 3:
- Total sentence: 4 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years) - consecutive to Ct. 1
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision 
- Restitution - hearing to be set
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with victims or residences or Robert K..  Do not enter into anyone's residence's without the Agents approval.  Mental Health/psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.   

  Restitution hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
